english_translation: Narrated by Abu Musa al-Ash'ari: Allah will spread His wing over the believers on the Day of Judgment like this (and he indicated with his hand above him), and will say: 'O son of Adam, this is a good deed you did in such and such place at such and such time, and I have accepted it from you.' Then the believer will prostrate. Then He will say: 'O son of Adam, this is an evil deed you committed on such and such day, and I have forgiven you for it.' Then the believer will prostrate. The creation will say: 'Blessed is this slave - in his record is seen nothing but good deeds because of how much he prostrates.' Then when it is finished, he will say: 'Read your book, I thought I would meet my account,' - meaning he will say: 'I now know (for certain)'.

english_translation: Narrated by Humaid al-Tawil: I asked al-Hasan regarding His saying 'Man is created fretful' (Surah al-Ma'arij 70:19). He said: Read what comes after it. So I recited: 'When misfortune touches him, he is fretful, and when good touches him, he is miserly' (Surah al-Ma'arij 70:20-21). He said: This is the fretfulness - thus man was created.
